title: Introduction to number theory lecture 47. The prime number theorem

media:group.media:title: Introduction to number theory lecture 47. The prime number theorem
media:group.media:description:
This lecture is part of my Berkeley math 115 course "Introduction to number theory"
For the other lectures in the course see https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8yHsr3EFj53L8sMbzIhhXSAOpuZ1Fov8

We give an overview of the prime number theorem, stating that the number of primes less than x is about x/log x

Zagier's article about the proof: https://www.jstor.org/stable/2975232

The textbook is "An introduction to the theory of numbers" by Niven, Zuckerman, and Montgomery (5th edition).
